image.title: The latest news from News Center.

item.title: Old cell phones
item.creator: olah
item.description: Wanted old cell phones to be donated to Mutual Ground a Women’s Shelter in Aurora, IL. Mutual Ground provides service to victims of domestic violence and sexual assault in Kendall and southern Kane counties. If you have any old phones around your house, please consider donating them. Please contact Jeannette Olah at 630 404-0699 or olah@fnal.gov
item.comment: Wanted old cell phones to be donated to Mutual Ground a Women’s Shelter in Aurora, IL. Mutual Ground provides service to victims of domestic violence and sexual assault in Kendall and southern Kane counties. If you have any old phones around your house, please consider donating them. Please contact Jeannette Olah at 630 404-0699 or olah@fnal.gov

item.title: Video: Feynman diagrams
item.creator: leah
item.description: Feynman diagrams encode information on how particle physics collisions unfold. But they have an even deeper significance. Don Lincoln gives you a peek into the deeper meaning of these important scientific pictograms.
item.comment: Feynman diagrams encode information on how particle physics collisions unfold. But they have an even deeper significance. Don Lincoln gives you a peek into the deeper meaning of these important scientific pictograms.

item.title: Fermi Philosophy Society, Feb 25, 12:00 Req Room (WH4NW)
item.creator: burov
item.description: Al Brunsting will give his 3rd talk (out of 4) on Design vs Accident. This time he will focus on the problem of life. How might the Earth have been a place where life started and developed? Everybody is welcome. Feel free to come with your lunch.
item.comment: Al Brunsting will give his 3rd talk (out of 4) on Design vs Accident. This time he will focus on the problem of life. How might the Earth have been a place where life started and developed? Everybody is welcome. Feel free to come with your lunch.

item.title: Valentine’s Day glow
item.creator: tnicol
item.description: The tree at the corner of Wilson and B roads takes on a glow during the Valentine's Day snowfall.
item.comment: The tree at the corner of Wilson and B roads takes on a glow during the Valentine’s Day snowfall. See other views of this lovely tree . Photo: Tom Nicol, TD

item.title: Special DZero Wine and Cheese seminar on Thursday, Feb. 25, at 4 p.m. in One West
item.creator: denisovd
item.description: The DZero experiment will present a special Wine and Cheese seminar, “Observation of a new resonance state in the Bs pi system” this Thursday, Feb. 25, at 4 p.m. in One West. The seminar will be video streamed at http://vms.fnal.gov/asset/livevideo and the slides will be posted at http://theory.fnal.gov/jetp/. Mark your calendar to attend!
item.comment:
The DZero experiment will present a special Wine and Cheese seminar, “Observation of a new resonance state in the B s pi system” this Thursday, Feb. 25, at 4 p.m. in One West.

The seminar will be video streamed at http://vms.fnal.gov/asset/livevideo and the slides will be posted at http://theory.fnal.gov/jetp/ .

Mark your calendar to attend!

item.title: Help us improve Fermilab’s Wikipedia pages
item.creator: Lauren
item.description: Are you an active Wikipedia editor? Interested in lending your skills to the lab? Fermilab’s Wikipedia pages could use an update. If you’d like to help us refresh relevant Wikipedia pages so they contain current information, please contact lbiron@fnal.gov.
item.comment: Are you an active Wikipedia editor? Interested in lending your skills to the lab? Fermilab’s Wikipedia pages could use an update. If you’d like to help us refresh relevant Wikipedia pages so they contain current information, please contact lbiron@fnal.gov .

item.title: Line Dancing registration due March 1
item.creator: jkoester
item.description: The next session of Line Dancing will be held on Tuesdays, March 8-April 26 from 11:30 a.m.-12:15 p.m. in the Upper Level of Kuhn Barn. Fee is $65. Register by March 1 in the Wellness Office, WH15W. http://wdrs.fnal.gov/wellness/classes.html
item.comment: The next session of Line Dancing will be held on Tuesdays, March 8-April 26 from 11:30 a.m.-12:15 p.m. in the Upper Level of Kuhn Barn. Fee is $65. Register by March 1 in the Wellness Office, WH15W. http://wdrs.fnal.gov/wellness/classes.html

item.title: March 7 deadline for The University of Chicago Tuition Remission Program
item.creator: karlix
item.description: The deadline for applying for the tuition remission program at The University of Chicago for the spring 2016 quarter is March 7, 2016. For more information and enrollment forms, contact Karen Karlix at karlix@fnal.gov or visit the website http://wdrs.fnal.gov/train-dev/uchicago.html
item.comment: The deadline for applying for the tuition remission program at The University of Chicago for the spring 2016 quarter is March 7, 2016. For more information and enrollment forms, contact Karen Karlix at karlix@fnal.gov or visit the website http://wdrs.fnal.gov/train-dev/uchicago.html

item.title: OSG helps LIGO confirm Einstein’s theory
item.creator: leah
item.description: From Science Node , Feb. 17, 2016: Einstein predicted gravitational waves over 100 years ago. Resources provided by the Open Science Grid, of which Fermilab is an active member, are helping LIGO prove he was right.
item.comment: From Science Node , Feb. 17, 2016: Einstein predicted gravitational waves over 100 years ago. Resources provided by the Open Science Grid, of which Fermilab is an active member, are helping LIGO prove he was right.

item.title: SPOT awards available
item.creator: debseb
item.description: In case you wondered if we still have a SPOT award program, the answer is YES! A new installment of Target gift cards has arrived.
item.comment:
In case you wondered if we still have a SPOT award program, the answer is YES! A new installment of Target gift cards have arrived.  Based on trends from the past two years, cards will now be distributed to organizations on a first-come, first-served basis. HR Partners will provide Division contacts increments of 25 cards as requested until they are gone.

It has been inspiring to see literally hundreds of nominations by peers and supervisors that show that our Lab employees exemplify traits such as:
·        “always willing to provide assistance to the other people in her group”
·        “shows extra effort and provides outstanding support”
·        “demonstrates great teamwork and technical skills”
·        “goes beyond expectations”
·        “attacks many problems where an obvious solution was not in sight”

The list goes on and on … who will you nominate next?

Please note that IRS regulations require the Lab to designate the $25 gift card as taxable. View the policy here . Contact your HR Partner with any questions or suggestions.
